(Ex) Mutual Information
▪ Suppose we have two sets of values x and y to compare
– x = (–3, –2, –1, 0, 1, 2, 3), y = (9, 4, 1, 0, 1, 4, 9)
– Although there is a relationship yk = xk
2, their correlation is 0
▪ However, their mutual information I(x, y) = 1.9502
– I(x, y) = H(x) + H(y) – H(x, y) = 2.8074 + 1.9502 – 2.8074
71

text.text: ▪ Suppose we have two sets of values x and y to compare
– Although there is a relationship yk = xk
▪ However, their mutual information I(x, y) = 1.9502
